schopenhauer_scene: ^A single candle fights the dark, its flame shaking in a breathless room.
^The walls are covered with mirrors — cracked, smeared, each one reflecting a version of you that looks a little less alive.
^Schopenhauer sits on the floor, back against the wall, coat draped over his knees.
^He doesn’t look up. He just speaks.
^Tell me something, before the light goes out.
^Do you still think the world means well?

c-0: ^The world doesn’t care if you breathe or choke — it just keeps turning.
^That’s what living things do: they consume.
c-1: ^ When I thought God was watching.
^You built the eye that judged you. Then you prayed to it.
c-2: ^The light you see isn’t hope — it’s decay burning slow enough to look pretty.
c-3: ^ I just live. Eat. Drink. Sleep.
^Thought is the wound. Animals are lucky — they bleed, but they don’t _know_ they’re bleeding.

schopenhauer_reflection: ^The mirrors hum softly, like glass remembering screams.
^Your reflection blurs — it’s you, but hollow, like someone scraped out the part that believed in morning.
^It takes your hunger, your love, your faith, and turns them into reasons to keep you chained here.
^You can’t win. You can only stop struggling long enough to see the cage.
^Did you ever find peace in all that noise?

c-0: ^That’s all peace ever is — a pause before the next wave hits.
^You thought it was the shore. It was just the eye of the storm.
c-1: ^Some people spend their whole lives trying to turn pain into poetry. You just let it rot.
c-2: ^Then stop calling it life. Call it what it is — hunger that doesn’t know what it wants.
^Every heartbeat’s just the body begging for something it can’t have.
c-3: ^The longest con the Will ever pulled.
^It makes you bleed for someone else and calls it virtue.

schopenhauer_suffering: ^The candle wavers. Shadows stretch across the mirrors until your reflection looks like it’s drowning in black water.
^Schopenhauer’s eyes finally rise — gray, hollow, too tired to hate.
^You think you’ve suffered more than others. You haven’t.
^That’s the curse of being aware — every scream, every wound in the world becomes a mirror.
^You carry them until you forget which one was yours.

c-0: ^Death doesn’t fix it. The Will doesn’t care if you die — it just starts over with someone new.
^It’ll build another fool and give him your hunger.
c-1: ^Maybe that’s the closest thing to wisdom — not joy, not faith, just the quiet that comes when you stop begging for better.
c-2: ^ If we all hurt, maybe we can soften it.
^Compassion’s the only rebellion left — the only time the Will shuts up.
^But don’t lie to yourself. You still help others because it makes _you_ hurt less.
c-3: ^You can’t kill the Will. Every death just feeds it.
^You’d be another offering — and it would thank you by forgetting.

schopenhauer_final: ^For a second, everything stops — even your heartbeat sounds like it’s holding its breath.
^Schopenhauer speaks from the dark. His voice sounds close enough to touch.
^You want to know what the world is?
^It’s a wound that heals just enough to keep bleeding again.
^He exhales — not like a sigh, but like giving up on breathing.
^If you still want to live, do it quietly. Don’t dream. Don’t reach. Don’t make more noise than you must.
^Every want is another scream in a world that’s already deaf.

c-0: ^Then the world will thank you in its own way — by forgetting you completely.
c-1: ^ I’ll live loud. Even if it hurts.
^Then scream. Let the Will sing through you.
^The brave ones don’t win — they just burn better.
c-2: ^If there’s any redemption, it’s in the small mercies no one notices.
c-3: ^Then wear it like armor. Just remember — armor rusts from the inside.

schopenhauer_scene_end: ^The darkness thickens until even your reflection disappears.
^Somewhere far off, a sound — maybe wind, maybe breathing, maybe the world still turning.
^The world isn’t evil. It’s just hungry.
^It eats everything that tries to mean something.
^If you can’t stop it — at least don’t feed it.
